title: Mystery NSW winner wins entire Oz Lotto $50 million jackpot
text:
The hunt is on to find Australia's newest multimillionaire after Oz Lotto's $50 million jackpot went off on Tuesday night.

The jackpot for draw 1339 rocketed to the third biggest offered so far this year with no division one winners for the last six weeks.

One lucky division one winner from New South Wales is now a life-changing $50million richer.

But the winner remains a mystery and may be still unaware they've hit the jackpot as The Lott officials have no way of contacting the unregistered player.

Thousands of Australians are checking their tickets after Tuesday night's Oz Lotto draw

'Someone has become an overnight mid-week multi-millionaire but possibly doesn't know it yet,' The Lott spokeswoman Bronwyn Spencer said.

'We can’t wait for them to discover this winning news!'

The numbers drawn on Tuesday night were 5, 32, 22, 13, 20, 25 and 42.

The supplementary numbers were 21 and 23.

Unregistered players in NSW are urged to check their tickets.

'If you discover you’re holding the division one winning entry, hold on tight to that ticket and phone 131 868 as soon as possible so that we can start the prize claim process,' Ms Spencer said.

The area the winning ticket was bought will be revealed on Wednesday morning unless the mystery winner comes forward to claim their prize.

Twelve division two winners also won more than $42,000 each, including two from NSW.

Tuesday's night division one winner became the tenth Oz Lotto winner who have shared in $285 million won so far this year.

Three were from Victoria and NSW while Queensland had two.

Tasmania and South Australia have both had one Oz Lotto division one win.

All but two of the Oz Lotto division one winning entries so far this year have been QuickPick entries where the numbers were randomly generated.

The Oz Lotto jackpot was previously last won in August by an Adelaide man who won $10 million, who said at the time it was 'weird' to learn he had become a millionaire.

It comes after three winners shared the massive $150 million Powerball jackpot which went off last month.

The prize jackpotted from $100million after no winners claimed the first division prize in the previous draw.

Lottery officials said around half of all adult Australians entered the Powerball draw, which eclipses the previous record prize of $107.6 million which went off in January.

The next Oz Lotto draw is next Tuesday night.
description: The hunt is on to find Australia's newest multimillionaire after Oz Lotto's $50 million jackpot went off on Tuesday night. One lucky division one winner from NSW is now $50million richer.
authors: Kylie Stevens For Daily Mail Australia
